alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an amide derivative of carboxylic acid, with the general structure RN(R1)C(R2)=O (R1-R2 any atom but H).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that carry a hydroxy and an amino functional groups on an alkane backbone.
alternative_parents.name: Alkanolamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Organic molecules synthesized by chain elongation of an acetyl-CoA primer with malonyl-CoA (or methylmalonyl-CoA) groups that might contain a cyclic functionality and/or are substituted with heteroatoms.
class.name: Fatty Acyls

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as n-acyl amines. These are compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.
direct_parent.name: N-acyl amines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Carboxylic acid amide derivatives of fatty acids, that are formed from a fatty acid and an amine.
subclass.name: Fatty amides

superclass.description: Fatty acids and their derivatives, and substances related biosynthetically or functionally to these compounds.
superclass.name: Lipids and lipid-like molecules
